text: Twenty boys, aged 7 to 12, sit at spartan desks, bibles r O'NEAL walks amongst them. A career Jesuit with razor eye awful man.
(sternly)  Sumeria.   And what happened to him Francis?  FRANCIS, 12, is the eldest and largest boy.
Jesus' disciples came and performed  miracles. When Simon Magus saw the  miracles he offered disciple Peter  gold for the powers of God.

What did disciple Peter say to that?  Michael Quinn?  Father O'Neal stands before the youngest, littlest boy, w exhibits no fear in his huge, intelligent eyes. Father O' The boy, MICHAEL QUINN, doesn't respond.   Father O'Neal snatches his bible, revealing a SECOND BOOK It's a dime store pulp adventure with a gaudy cover entit
Answer the question Michael.   The little boy stares up at him.

That's not my name.   Father O'Neal yanks the boy from the chair. Drags him by room and out into the corridor.   THE OTHER BOYS wait two seconds, then they spring up and to the door. Grouped in the threshold, straining for a go as --  FATHER O'NEIL pulls Michael Quinn into an office down the has a stained-glass window.   It begins. We see it in SILHOUETTE: Father O'Neal with a his hand, the boy beneath him. Down the switch comes. Aga The boy YELPS. And again and again and again... and now h THE BOYS HUDDLED IN THE DOORWAY begin to wince. With ever merciless descent of the switch...

THE BOYS sit at benches. Michael Quinn stares stoically a his shirt is striped with blood.   FATHER YIN, 50's, a Chinese Jesuit, grim in black frock a paces amongst the benches. Father O'Neal watches from the

Why one child is born into a good  home and another into poverty - that  is but part of God's design. All of  you are unwanted, put here because  of the sins of your unwedded  mothers. The church has fed you and  educated you. Given you a home. A  name. An identity.   Stopping before Michael Quinn, he points to a PORTRAIT ON stern-faced Jesuit.
Who is that, boy?
Father Michael Quinn.

Yes. A great man. You ungrateful  little cur, you will sit here  without food until you appreciate  your namesake.   (to the other boys)  All of you will sit with him. Put  lunch away, Mr. Fong.   MR. FONG, the orphanage cook, wheels a FOOD CART into the locks the door. Father Yin exits, followed by Father O'Ne leaving --  A HUNDRED BOYS staring at Michael Quinn.
Again, Father Yin stands before Michael Quinn. The boys a evening meal.
What is your name, boy?  Silence. Michael Quinn stares straight ahead.
Put supper away, Mr. Fong.   MR. FONG wheels the FOOD CART into the kitchen and locks a hundred boys stare at Michael Quinn.
A long, narrow room with bunkbeds. The boys aren't sleepi grouped around Michael Quinn's bunk. One boy has his hand Michael's, mouth, the others are wailing on him... and ou
Fathers O'Neal and Yin watch through the door.
Spareth the rod, spoileth the child.
Father Yin grits his teeth, staring down at Michael Quinn welted. Nothing has changed.
Put breakfast away, Mr. Fong.  Again, the FOOD CART goes into the kitchen. The Fathers a The boys rise, moving toward Michael Quinn. They're going shit out of him.

Stop. You'll have your breakfast.   Michael Quinn walks to the locked kitchen door.   The other boys, curious, follow.   Michael Quinn kneels before the door, examining the lock. On a counter next to the door are EATING UTENSILS. Michae A FORK. He bends the fork's tines. Inserts it in the lock He fishes around for a second. Nothing happens. He pulls rebends it, and inserts it in the lock again. And CLICK.. Michael Quinn turns and smiles. The boys flood inside.   The hungry boys go for the food cart, scooping up eggs an ravenous. Francis, mouth full of sausage, beams at Michae
They should've named you Simon, like  Simon Magus the sorcerer.

No. Simon. . . .   (pulls the "KNIGHTS TEMPLAR" paperback from his back pock ...Templar.   Suddenly a SHARP WHISTLE. The boys, startled, whip their MR. FONG stands in the doorway.   Father O'Neal and Father Yin enter quickly.   The boys back away from the food cart.
Who.. . who did this...?  The boys look at Michael Quinn. Then Francis speaks:
I did father.   And another boy, James:
I did father. .   And another and another: "I did father." They all say it. youngest boy, surrounded by his new confederates, smiles glint.
Begin MAIN TITLE SEQUENCE

A chilly September night. A rally is underway in the Dvor the vast square at the foot of Nevsky Prospect Boulevard. and Hermitage loom in the b.g.   500,000 ST. PETERS BURGERS' stand shoulder-to-shoulder, l SPEECH. INTERNATIONAL T.V. CREWS (the BBC, CNN, etc.) are the event.   SPEAKER (o.s.)  In I917 Lenin stood here and  promised a new age. The result?  Tyranny. Poverty. The darkest  years in our history.   THE SPEAKER stands on a platform behind a cluster of micr image projected on a huge screen (like the Sony screen in above and behind him.   He is MICHAEL ROMANOV, coal-haired, fierce, ardent, eyes voice cutting the night air.

In 1987 Gorbachev stood here and  promised a new age. The result? An  end to communism. Democracy. A  free economy. And what else?  Chaos.   (crowd CHEERS)  The economy run by criminals, the  government run by charlatans. And  they are in league together!  Thieves! Traitors!  (louder CHEERS)  Men and women of St. Petersburg,  citizens of Russia, the salt of this  country, this must end!  (deafening CHEERS)  Join me then in the song of our  forefathers.   Romanov begins to sing, ably, the first verse of "Mother (the Russian anthem before the Bolsheviks).   THE CROWD joins him. The Ploshchad rings with the voices Russians...

We're 12 stories up, outside the city's Nikko hotel.   The rally across town is a distant glow.   We hear the singing crowd.   TWO HANDS appear, gripping the nooks of the exterior arch IN BLACK climbs up, securing a sling to the window frame bulky BACKPACK hangs from shoulder straps.   He produces a diamond cutter; begins carving a man-sized window. Below, in the foyer
-- A JAPANESE SECURITY MAN sits at his guard station, wat NEWS on a small television. Wolf Blitzer is reporting liv

(on t.v.) An extraordinary allegation,  Bernard, that Russia's present  leadership, including President  Victor Karpov, is connected with the  country's underworld.   Inside the foyer ballroom, Japanese businessmen are hosti Nikko Hotel's core is hollow, like the Hilton in New York "ceiling" is 12 stories up.   CHAMPAGNE SERVERS are passing out glasses. A grey-haired businessman, HIRO MYAKI, clinks his glass. The guests pay During this we focus on a CHAMPAGNE SERVER moving toward elevators with a full tray.
Ladies. Gentlemen. The Myaki  Corporation looks forward to many  profitable days ahead. To our new  manufacturing facility in St.   Petersburg. To the new Russia!  As the crowd CLAPS...
...the Man In Black kicks at the cut section of window, p hotel and plunging inside after it.

The Man In Black catches hold of a steel girder and dangl miraculously --  THE PIECE OF WINDOW doesn't fall.   It's stuck to his feet with suction cups.   The Man In Black moves, hand over hand, toward the mezzan window stuck to his feet.
Everybody's beaming, toasting, congratulating, etc., tota MAN IN BLACK, 12 stories up, inching hand-over-hand acros superstructure.
The Man In Black has reached the mezzanine.   TWO JAPANESE SECURITY GUARDS, armed with automatic rifles shift directly below him. They pass a wall mounted televi the NEWS:

(on t.v.)  One thing's certain, Bernard:  Michael Romanov, age 32, French born  and Oxford educated, descendent of  the last czar, is a political force  to be reckoned with.   The guards move down the mezzanine; one jokes, the other disappear around a corner.   The Man in Black hangs from the girder with one hand; wit yanks the piece of window off his foot-mounted suction cu He drops to the mezzanine. He rests the glass against the the balustrade at the party below. Satisfied, he removes This is SIMON TEMPLAR. A hard, self-reliant, crafty man. as such or be very sorry you ever met him. It is unfortun Templar's various talents can be so lacking. How?  His journey has been through a tough world and he has com gives no quarter. Ever. Though his outward self glows wit Templar, focused utterly, steals inside a corridor.
A long corridor with a door at the end, on which is engra CORPORATION. At the entrance, secured in a niche, is a BR

Templar stops cold. A RUG (an oriental runner) extends th corridor.   Templar kneels, lifting an edge of the rug.   Revealing ANTI -THEFT PRESSURE SENSORS.   Templar produces a DARTGUN (the size of a flare gun, sile of steel cable attached to the top). He aims down the cor A STEEL DART explodes from the barrel, spooling out the c above the door at corridor's end.   Templar yanks the other end of cable from the spool. He l something to secure it.

Sorry about this.   He ties the cable around Myaki's bronze neck.   He hangs from the cable, testing it. It will hold.   He pulls out an aluminum contraption with small wheels an It's A GLIDER for the cable.   He attaches the glider to the cable, grips the handles, a the corridor.

head_text.subj: THE OTHER END OF THE CORRIDOR

text: Templar bumps up against the door. He pulls his knees up handles of the glider, then flops over backwards, hanging HIS FACE is now right next to the door handle, over which LOCK (opened by punching a code).   Templar pulls out a BLACK BOX. It's a really small, reall and its job is to run through every possible number combi minute and a half. Templar wires the computer to the lock
He activates the system. The little computer starts runni combinations of numbers. He waits, hanging upside down. M
The Japanese guards are smoking by the elevator, joking, these guys is a riot...   The elevator opens. The CHAMPAGNE SERVER comes out, tray
Compliments of Mr. Myaki.
(delighted)  Ahh!  Beaming, they each take a glass. They clink and drink.

The computer BEEPS. It's finished.   Templar turns the door handle; pushes open the door.   He pulls himself up. Hangs from his hands again.   He swings his legs back and forth, getting momentum up.   He releases from the glider and lunges inside.
A grand boardroom with Japanese furniture and art.   At the end of a fifty-foot mahogany table is a PAINTING O Templar walks over to it.

Sorry again.   He RIPS the painting off the wall and heaves it aside.   And here, where the painting was, is A SAFE.   Templar unshoulders his backpack. He pulls out a 40-pound RINKER industrial diamond-tipped drill, as big as a jackh here, people.   No, there's no time for high-tech. He's going to drill ri right through four inches of tungsten steel. He starts se
Two CHAMPAGNE GLASSES lie shattered on the floor, and nex lie the JAPANESE GUARDS, now unconscious. The champagne s gone...

...because he's here, moving quickly toward the Myaki Cor and he's not a champagne server, but a thief and a killer named ILYA.   Ilya stops just outside the interior corridor. With the G shuts off the anti-theft mats and moves around the corner
Ilya stops short. His eyes spark.   He sees Templar's cable and glider.

Templar, wearing goggles, leans into the drill as THE BIT tungsten lock. This is a violent exercise. SINEWS OF META shrapnel.   He's through the lock in seconds. Templar heaves the dril a THUD on the beautiful mahogany table. He opens the safe INSIDE THE SAFE is one object: A SMALL BOX, the size of a Templar grabs it and opens it.   INSIDE THE LITTLE BOX is a tiny MICRO-CHIP.   Templar closes the box and pockets it.   ILYA (v.o.)  Don't move.   Templar freezes. His eyes twitch.   This wasn't in the plan...   ILYA (v.o.)  Turn around. Slowly.   Templar faces Ilya. Ilya has a silenced handgun.

On your knees.   (Templar sinks to his knees)  Give me the box. Slowly.   Templar pulls out the box. Tosses it to Ilya.   Ilya raises the handgun at Templar's head. Smiles.   Try something: throw an extension cord on the ground. I g land coiled in several places.   Ilya happens to be standing inside one of the coils of th cord.   And this is not lost on Templar.   Templar, on his knees, grabs the cord and yanks it; the c Ilya's ankles. His legs fly from under him and he goes do clattering across the floor.   Ilya tries to get to his feet.   Templar floors him with a right cross.   Templar grabs the box and his backpack and sprints across gains his feet and grabs his gun; sprints after Templar.

Templar runs to the balustrade and climbs atop it.   He jumps, clutching the ceiling girder above.   He's going out the way he came in.   Suddenly ILYA'S HANDS are around his ankles.   Templar falls. He's going 12 stories to his death.   No. His fingers clutch the outside of the balustrade. Tem looking up at the sadistic face of Ilya. And suddenly bel
-- A JAPANESE WOMAN, looking up, pointing at the man dang balustrade above, SCREAMS. And now everybody looks up.
Sound the alarm! Call the police!
Ilya and Templar. Ilya calmly compresses his foot against knuckles.

The box please.   Templar, grimacing, reaches with his right hand and pulls pocket. Hands it slowly to Ilya, who reaches over the bal TEMPLAR stuffs the box in his teeth and grabs Ilya's hand the balustrade.   Ilya falls 12 stories to his death.   No he doesn't. He falls one story and miraculously catche there

Templar clambers up again, atop the balustrade.   He jumps to the ceiling girder.   Hand over hand, swinging like an acrobat, Templar's acros seconds.   He releases from the girder to the window frame.   There's one further problem. BULLETS. Ricocheting all aro ILYA, one floor down.   Templar reaches over his shoulder. Pulls a GUN from his b fire? No, it's the DART GUN.   Templar aims the dart gun out the aperture he cut in the
A STEEL DART launches from the window, flies fifty yards, STAIRCASE BULKHEAD OF THE BUILDING ADJACENT TO THE NIKKO.
Templar ties the cable to the ceiling girder.   He pulls out his black hood and drapes it over the taught ends of the hood.   And he jumps.

Templar flies through space, across the cable, the hood a glider.   He lands on the roof of the adjacent building.   Templar looks around. SIRENS ARE WAILING.   He runs across rooftops, disappearing into the St. Peters
Total chaos. Women screaming, everybody running around. I through the panicked crowd.   Ten ST. PETERSBURG POLICEMEN enter.
I tried to stop him! He went out  the window!  Five policemen go for the elevators. Five more exit quick
The befuddled police race off, looking skyward at the top building.   Ilya curses silently. And peels away from the cops and co the night.
The First Class section. The plane is in flight.   A STEWARDESS, young, perky, comes down the aisle pushing magazine/newspaper cart.

Newspaper sir?  SIMON TEMPLAR sits there, dressed as usual without much h Note this, reader: Templar is not a super-spy, super-hero is a thief.   He's examining several antique Russian BRACELETS and LOCK up at the stewardess.
(Cockney)  Wow, are those gorgeous or what...
You have an eye for beauty. Of course - you see it every look in the mirror.   She blushes, fidgets, as his eyes bore in on her.
Why thank-you, Mr...   (reads seat assignment)  Templar.   She continues down the aisle, smiling to herself.   Templar resumes with his lockets.
The plane has landed.   PASSENGERS are filing out past the Stewardess.
Goodbye, goodbye, enjoy your stay in London, etc.   Templar moves past the Stewardess, carrying TWO CARRY-ON winks at her. She winks back, and fingers one of the RUSS around her neck.
Good-bye, Mr. Templar.   As Templar moves off, she smiles to herself and CUT TO:

Templar walks briskly away from customs.   A MAN IN TRENCHCOAT falls in behind Templar.   TWO MEN appear in front of Templar, blocking his path; th Templar comes to his side. They are Scotland Yard men BAK
How's the weather in St. Petersburg?
Cold.
Let's warm things up for you.   Baker and Teal gruffly take Templar by the shoulder and w
A spartan room, a table and two chairs. MacDuff ransacks while, across the room --  Templar kisses the wall, hands outstretched, as Baker fin Templar turns.
He's clean.
(to MacDuff)  Careful with that. It's delicate  equip...   MacDuff lifts Templar's 9MM PISTOL from the bag.
. . . ment.
Yes. Very.
It's for protection.   I deal in antique....
(snaps)  I know what you deal in. And these?  Your pajamas?  He holds up Templar's black bodysuit.
For jogging. My doctor's  recommended five miles a...
Sit down and shut it.   Templar sits down.   Baker has Templar's papers. He holds up a certificate.
He's licensed to carry, Inspector.
Let's see the passport.   (Baker hands MacDuff  Templar's passport)  What's your nationality this week,  Templar?
I forget.
(looks at passport)  Issued by the Principality  of.. . Yemen? You're bloody joking.
(shrugs)  Call the embassy  MacDuff whips the passport at Templar. Templar calmly mov passport flies by. Hits the wall.
Shut it.   MacDuff leans down, coming in close.   Templar doesn't blink. His expression never changes.

You pass through Russia for a day  with that gear and, what a surprise, a prototype  computer chip worth quarter of a billion quid is nicked  from the Myaki Corporation the night you arrive. We know  you didn't fence it in Russia. Where is it?  The door opens. Teal enters, tossing several X-RAY PHOTOG table before MacDuff. Two are of Templar's bags, two are
(Cockney)  All negative. He didn't swallow it.   An embarrassing pause.
You've got three options: charge me,  or release me.
What's the third.

You can kiss my ass.   A dreadful pause. MacDuff smiles.   He turns away, then turns back and viciously backhands Te face; Templar's head jerks. The blow would knock most men Now Templar smiles. Like a serpant. And says calmly:
I'm a busy man. Make up your mind.   MacDuff stares at Templar, gritting his teeth.   Templar rises. Begins collecting his things.
A quaint place off Piccadilly. The STEWARDESS (from Templ martini. She is tipsy. She shows it.
.. . then me mum says, call uncle  Charlie, he's in the airline  business, there's jobs there, good  benefits too, and.. ..where was I?  TEMPLAR, enduring this, sits opposite with a scotch.
How you got your job.
Right!  (hiccups, giggles)  'Scuze me.   Templar motions to a passing WAITRESS.
Another round please.
Ye're tryin' ta get me drunk, aren't  you? Are you cute or what? I gotta  freshen up.   (she rises)  Where's the loo in 'ere?
Back there. Leave your locket.   I'll polish it for you.   She smiles crookedly; hands over the locket.

Are you a dearheart or what...   She blows Templar a kiss and lurches off to the bathroom. her a moment.   When she's gone he puts the locket on the table.   He pries open the back of it with a pen-knife.   INSERT - THE LOCKET - there is a compartment in which sit MICRO-CHIP. Templar plucks out the chip and drops it into
as she returns to the table. She sits down. Looks around. locket's gone. The waitress appears.
Maam, where's the gent who was  sitting 'ere?
He left, luv. Said you'd take care  of the bill.   She hands the Stewardess the bill. She stares at it.
What?  She sinks down, confused, blinking, near tears. CUT TO:
A small, plush, discrete residential hotel in the heart o
Mr. Templar! Good to see you sir.   Your room key - south penthouse as  usual. Your suits are up from storage,  pressed of course, and  there's a bottle of Oban on the  dresser.
Thanks Harry. Oh, and Harry...   (pulls out the envelope with the computer chip)  .. . ship this by overnight courier to that address.
Very good sir.   JIMMY, a young Bellman, takes Ternplar's bags. Templar do uncomfortable pause.
Jimmy, Mr. Templar carries his own bags.   Templar steps past Jimmy into the elevator.
What's with the bags, gov'nuh?
They're all he ever brings. The  man's bills are paid by a bank in  Switzerland and his mailing address  is a corporation in Lisbon. Bloody strange...
Mr. Templar, strange? No sir, he's  just shy.

Ternplar sits at a desk with a bottle of Oban scotch and screen of a modemed MINI-COMPUTER.   -- Templar types: LION CONTACTING ZEBRA: IS ZEBRA HOME?  -- And this comes back: AFFIRMATIVE, LION.   -- Templar types: PIGEON IS FLYING; WILL ARRIVE A.M.   -- And this back: EXCELLENT. LION GETS LION'S SHARE. -- T new command. A new screen appears:
Templar types in: 77N8LS473Z. This appears:

BALANCE (AS OF 8/1S/95): U.S. $47,895,12S.12 (Not a typo, Templar picks up his scotch and drinks, staring at the sc something...   The first digit, "4," vanishes.   A "5" appears in it's place. Now fifty-seven million.   Templar permits a slight smile, having just made 10 milli drinks his scotch.   The phone RINGS. Templar eyes it skeptically. He picks it
Yes.   A voice with an Eastern European accent:
Is this Simon Templar?
It depends.
A meeting. Midnight, Blackfriars  Bridge.
Involving what?
A lot of money. If you want it.   Click. Templar recradles the receiver; He stares at it a
Templar enters the lobby wearing a fresh suit under a bla coat. He goes to the desk, where concierge Harry Winston
Harry, I'm going for a walk over  Blackfriars Bridge. Midnight.   Pause. And Harry, just perceptibly, nods. And returns to
Very good, sir.   Templar walks off through the lobby.
Jimmy  (Jimmy walks over)  It's about time I taught you how to  run the front desk.

Fog. The bridge lights cast everything in a sickly yellow TUGBOAT plows the river, horn BELLOWING. The lights of So beyond.   Templar enters from Victoria Embankment.   TWO FIGURES emerge from the fog. Templar approaches.   One is a huge dim-wit with greasy hair, as tall and wide name, aptly, is ZERO.   The other is middle-aged and strongly built. A high foreh hair; square jaw and aquiline nose; deep-set, ruthless, u This is GREGOR TRETIAK. To characterize him as the John G demean him. He is vastly more powerful.
Interesting.   (sizes up Templar)  You are not a big man. But men like  you never are. It is my pleasure,  Simon Templar. My name is...
I know who you are. Tell me what  you want, or I keep walking.
Suppose I don't want anything.   Suppose I want to kill you.
Suppose there's a high-powered rifle  trained at your head.   As Tretiak's eyes dart about, Templar raises his hand, wa someone below the bridge --
-- that someone is CONCIERGE HARRY WINSTON, in a cloth ca mack now, and yes, he has a 30.6 scoped rifle trained at BACK TO THE BRIDGE Tretiak's jaw muscles twitch. He smile
Rumour has not lied about you, Mr.   Templar. Last night something was  stolen in St. Petersburg. My city.
You talk about the place as if you  own it.
(sinisterly)  I do, Mr. Templar. May I ask who hired you?
You can ask. I won't answer.
What you stole I wanted very badly.   (beat)  Ilya.   Ilya emerges from the shadows.   Locks eyes with Templar. The thief from the Nikko!
What is the saying - if you can't  beat them, why not join them?  An American phrase, no? Or are you  British? Australian?
I'm nothing. Except bored.   Get to the point.

(smiles)  Of course. An American scientist  has worked ten years to develop a  certain technology. I am informed  that the technology will be made  public at the annual nuclear science  symposium in Washington D.C. I  would like the plans and  specifications for this technology.  Before the symposium.
What are we talking about?
A nuclear fusion generator. We have  a man on the inside.
Why can't he steal it?
He's tried. The scientist trusts no  one and keeps no hard records of the  technology in the lab.
Nuclear fusion. They say it's  mankind's only hope after all the  oil's gone. This guy's actually done it?
She.
Come again?
She, Mr. Templar. The scientist is a woman.   (hands over a dossier)  Her dossier. All the information  you will need.
My fee is fifteen million U.S.   dollars, half up front, half when I  deliver. You'll hear from me.   Templar turns and walks off.
Templar, one question.   Templar stops. Turns.
I ask you to steal a person's entire  life's work. You have no reaction.   Are you that cold?  Templar stares back, expressionless. He turns and disappe
No, rumor  hasn't lied about you, Templar.
Various establishing shots of this suburban community jus Manhattan. Pretty, charming, affluent.

A large suburban supermarket.   The aisles are full of Westchester women: affluent, count housewifey types.   A HAND reaches for a BOTTLE OF LEMONADE (100% Natural) , down to the eye level of --  JILLIAN ST. THOMAS. She is lean, a swimmer's body perhaps acuteness and authority in her thought, speech, and actio woman? Fine, but you'd better know what the hell you're t stare can stop a train.   She's casually dressed. Only her JACKET stands out.   It's waist-cut, with a colorful diagram of protons and el nucleus embroidered on the back.

(reads ingredients)  Filtered water, high fructose corn  syrup. Lemon juice concentrate.   Citric acid. Gum acacia...?  (grumbles)  Totally natural, yeah right.   She returns the bottle and turns, coming face-to-face wit wearing a moustache and glasses now.   He has a bottle of LEMON JUICE in his hand.
Try this.   (smiles)  Sorry, I overheard.   (hands her the bottle)  The real thing. No chemicals,  no preservatives.   She reads the label. Satisfied, she looks at Templar.
Thanks.   She puts it in her cart and wheels off and CUT TO:
Jillian is examining apples. There is a THUMPING NOISE. I she looks over at --  TEMPLAR. He's standing in front of the watermelons. He's his thumb. He notices Jillian.
Hello again. These aren't ripe.   How are the apples?
Excellent. They're in season.   Templar walks over to the apples. Picks one up. Studies i
I wonder why He didn't want us to eat these.   A pause. She looks at him, puzzled.
Who?
God. In the Garden of Eden.
Oh right. Sorry, little slow today.   Bad headache.   (looks at the apple)  Uhm, actually, I don't know.
Why wasn't it: "No bananas." Or:  "Avoid, at all cost, kumquats."  Wonder what God had against apples.   She gives him a funny look and turns away.
Sorry. Can't help you.
How about William Tell? You really  think he shot one of these off his  brother's head with an arrow?  Jillian turns around again. A pause.
Do I know you?
Unlikely. I just moved to New York.   She stares at him. This is a very strange man.   Intriguing yes, but also possibly a lunatic. She decides route:

Well uhhm, sir, to answer your apple  questions, one, I don't know what  God's problem was. Two, William  Tell, like Paul Bunyon, never  existed. And in case you're  wondering, Isaac Newton discovered  gravity through planetary  observation not because one of those  fell on his head, and I seriously doubt  that eating one a day will keep the doctor away.   (beat)  Okay?  She wheels her cart off. Says over her shoulder:
By the way - welcome to the Big Apple.   Templar watches her wheel off. His eyes glint. This is go interesting...
Jillian slams down the hatch of her station wagon, now fi She gets in.   The car pulls out of the parking lot.

Jillian, driving, drinking her lemonade, listens to a cas authoritative, scholarly, Indian voice:  VIJAY SINGH (v.o., cassette)  Nuclear fusion occurs when pairs of  nuclei meet and their protons and  neutrons fuse together into a single  nucleus. The fused nuclei move off  at high speed, producing energy.   Nuclear fusion could provide us  with almost unlimited power.
No, really? Moron.   VIJAY SINGH (v.o., cassette)  All you need are two hydrogen gases,  deuterium and lithium, and a machine  to make them fuse under controlled conditions.
C'mon, Dr. Singh. Tell me something  I don't know.   Jillian sees something through the windshield.   She turns down the volume and squints --
A ROLLS ROYCE sits on the road shoulder. As we pass the R SIMON TEMPLAR standing next to it wearing a hopeless expr
looks at the Rolls in the rear-view mirror. She frowns.
Just keep driving.   Jillian frowns again. Against her better judgment, she pu reverse.
Jillian's station wagon backs up to the Rolls Royce on th gets out.
Hello!  She walks up to him. Together they look down at THE REAR pancake.
Where's the spare?
I.. .well.. .I'm not really certain.

She hits him again.   Whitehead falls away from the car.   He rolls twenty feet and stops, dazed but alive.
Templar guns the sedan through a RED LIGHT. Cars to the l SCREECH to a stop. The sedan flies on...
We're going to the airport.   Templar guns the accelerator.
The TWO MERCEDES pull up to Whitehead, who staggers to hi in the lead Mercedes; the two cars race off after Templar
Templar floors it through another intersection. he looks mirror. There's no sign of the two Mercedes. They've esca
Good.

Is it? Who's worse   them or you?  Templar looks down and registers shock --  - - IN THE INTERSECTION AHEAD, A BLIND MAN with a walking tapping across the intersection.   Jillian cringes, expecting the worst. Templar throws the
-- The sedan swerves, clearing the BLIND MAN by two inche through the intersection.
Templar fights the wheel but he's losing...   The skid can't be corrected. Jillian SCREAMS.
The sedan slides sideways, hits the curb and flips over, across the sidewalk.
The Mercedes moves through traffic. Whitehead and the oth around. The Mercedes rounds a corner.   Across the intersection is the OVERTURNED SEDAN on the si surrounded by gawking PEDESTRIANS.

The Mercedes pulls up. Whitehead and his men get out. The the sedan, drawing guns. The pedestrians back off, gettin way.   Whitehead and his men surround the car. They kneel, guns inside...Templar and Jillian are gone.   Whitehead barks at his men.

Fifteen block radius.   Go house to house.   Whitehead looks around at the surrounding buildings. We F them, a RUSSIAN ORTHODOX CHURCH several blocks away, unde and mesh wire, in the process of renovation. CAMERA pushe church's HUGE ONION SHAPED TURRET. . . . .

... and we're in the turret's interior: round, with stain and chair. A trap door leading to the vestibule below BAN JILLIAN comes up, followed by Templar, his gun in hand.   They're cut and bruised, exhausted.   Jillian slumps against the wall, shivering.   Templar puts his equipment on the desk and goes to each o From this elevation he can see the entire city.   TEMPLAR'S FIRST POV - RED SQUARE, a mile across town, whe Muscovites are listening to a pro Michael Romanov speech. Shifting from Red Square to the city outskirts, we see MO INTERNATIONAL AIRPORT, where Remy waits.   TEMPLAR'S SECOND POV - THE UNITED STATES EMBASSY is just away - we see the American flag flying from the roof stan In the intersections around the embassy, Tretiak's men st vehicles, watching. Every point of access to the embassy We see WHITEHEAD. A Mercedes pulls up to him. ILYA gets o
The embassy's surrounded.
is staring at Templar's computer. The modem is engaging. staring at the screen.   Jillian reads an ELECTRONIC MESSAGE which appears:

head_text.subj: IN RETURN, 20 MILLION AND SAFE PASSAGE.
IF YOU REFUSE YOU WILL DIE.

text: Jillian's eyes grow wide with terror.   Templar looks out a third window.   TEMPLAR'S THIRD POV - Tretiak's men are going building to fifteen block radius sweep, closing in on the church.
The airport's out. They're drawing a  noose around us. We don't have much time.   TEMPLAR turns away from the window.  He sees Jillian look
What are you going to do? Tell me.  I deserve at least th (desperate now)  I'll die. If you take their offer, they'll kill me.
And if I don't, they'll kill me.   Interesting situation I'd say.   Jillian sinks to the chair, her voice shaking.
Oh god. It's over, it's all over...  You're not human. Yo
I'm a businessman. I perform services for profit. And spa (beat)  I'll make you an offer - pay me my fifteen million out of Pause. She slowly looks up at him.
I don't hold the patent rights to cold fusion.
What?
You fool. Don't you understand?  (her voice cracks; she begins to softly cry)  It wasn't about money, it wasn't about becoming rich...
If you don't own the patent rights, who does?

A foundation in my name. The royalties  were going to go to scientific research,  curing cancer, .. .christ how can you understand this... She lowers her head, weeping openly.   CAMERA PUSHES in on Templar, staring at her. Even the dar But we don't know this. Templar betrays nothing.   He picks up his homing device and clicks it on.   He types in this command: MOSCOW.   The device beeps; THE MOSCOW STREET GRID appears.   He types a new command: SUBTERRANEAN DATA.   Moscow's SUBTERRANEAN GRID appears superimposed over the we see the guts of the city; the Moscow subway, water and Templar analyzes the information on the screen.   He quickly rises; goes to Jillian, pulling off his belt. He pulls her up. She stands limply, still weeping, no lon bigger and stronger, there's no use. Templar gathers Jill and ties them with the belt.   He pulls her to the trapdoor and CUT TO:

Several pedestrians walk by. Templar walks Jillian quickl COVER. He kneels and hoists the cover off. He points into Jillian, her wrists bound, steps down uneasily, her feet a STEEL LADDER. She descends into the manhole. Templar fo

Jillian and Templar come down the ladder, dropping to the walkway over the Moscow sewer.   Templar pulls Jillian twenty feet down the walkway.   At this point in the wall there is a HATCH with a compres the turning of which opens the hatch, like on a submarine Within the hatch we hear RUSHING WATER.
That's a municipal water main.   In one hour you're going in there.   Templar pulls out a SWITCHBLADE. Clicks it on.   Jillian, shivering with terror, stares at the blade...
Listen. They shut it down twice a  day for five minutes to clean the filters.   Once at noon, once at midnight. Noon is in one hour.
How do you know all this?
Part of my job. Now ask the logical question...
.. . where does it go?
Very good. Under the United States Embassy.   There's an exit hatch into the embassy  courtyard. That's where we're going.
We...?  Templar lowers his gun. He lowers the blade to her wrists
You heard me.   A long pause. They stare at each other.
Then what happens?
Let's get to the embassy,  then we'll talk about it.
Templar - about that night at my house...
Don't talk about it, okay?  He turns away from her. She watches him.
Okay.

The Michael Romanov supporters are marching past the Krem PLACARDS BEARING ROMANOV'S FACE, chanting:  KARPOV MUST GO! Ahead, awaiting them, are --  Two units of MOSCOW POLICE in riot gear. A POLICE SERGEAN megaphone.
Disperse. Disperse!  On come the Romanov supporters. Rocks start flying. The R supporters push into the line of police. The police push
ROMANOV SUPPORTERS flood past the embassy gates, chased b Policemen. Fights rage allover the street. A full-fledged

head_text.subj: IN THE U. S. EMBASSY COURTYARD

text: A U. S. MARINE and ARMY GREEN BERET detachment, grimfaced armed, stand silent vigil inside the embassy's wrought-ir COLONEL WILLIAM CROSBY, embassy c.o., exits the embassy a approaches the front gates. A FULL BEER BOTTLE smashes at showering him.
Jesus H. Christ.

head_text.subj: ACROSS THE STREET FROM THE U. S. EMBASSY

text: Ilya and his men stand next to their vehicles, silently w
The WHOOSHING water in the municipal water main begins to INSERT - TEMPLAR'S WRISTWATCH - it is exactly 12 noon.
Right on time.   The water subsides to a trickle. Templar grips the hatchw
Four blocks. Right under Tretiak's men  and up into the embassy compound. You can do this.   She grabs Templar's hand. He pulls her up and inside --
-- a four foot diamater pipe. Templar pulls out a PENLIGH sticks it between his teeth. On hands and kneess Templar through the water main.
Templar and Jillian crawl up. Templar shines his penlight EXIT HATCH WITH HATCHWHEEL is above them.
It doesn't seem like we've gone far enough.
We haven't, up there's the street in  front of the embassy.   (looks at his wristwatch)  Come on. We've got two minutes.   They crawl off through the water main.
Templar and Jillian crawl toward A SECOND EXIT HATCH.
There it is.   They reach the exit hatch. They look at it.  Jillian trem
Oh my god...   The EXIT HATCH has no hatchwheel. It's sealed.   Jillian, panicked, looks down the water main.
We. ...we've got to go back.
(checks his watch)  Not enough time.   (thinks)  The hatch under the street.
What about Tretiak's men ...
Better than drowning.   They scramble off.  We hear WHOOSHING WATER coming down t
The water's back on!  Back they go, crawling as fast as they can.

Templar and Jillian reach the exit hatch under the street hatchwheel as --  THE WATER ROARS through the pipe, hitting Jillian flush, backward; she desperately clings to Templar's shoulders a hatchwheel.  The water rises mercilessly. There's a foot

- - and SMASHES against A ONE FOOT DIAMETER PIPE running of the service manhole, CRACKING a fissure in it. PRESSUR out of the pipe. TEMPLAR pulls himself up. He reaches dow JILLIAN looks at the GAS spewing from the cracked pipe.   She sniffs the air. Templar looks at the pipe. A warning languages: GAS - DANGEROUS.
City gas line.

We can't stay here,  we'll asphyxiate.   Templar and Jillian clamber up the steel runged ladder to Templar pushes up the manhole cover, popping his head out A POLICE VAN is rolling straight for his head. He ducks a manhole cover as the VAN RUMBLES over it.   Templar listens. Above, the van has stopped.   Templar pushes up the manhole cover. The VAN has stopped manhole.

location: STREET IN FRONT OF THE U. S. EMBASSY

text: Templar slithers out. Pulls up Jillian. They're under the The van's rear door opens; TEN MEN jump down to the pavem their BLACK BOOTS; they are MOSCOW POLICE, arriving to ar Templar and Jillian crawl toward the van's rear.   Templar looks toward THE U.S. EMBASSY. It's 100 yards awa 100 miles.

Both of us will never make it.   But one of us can.   (draws his gun)  Give me ten seconds, then  break for the embassy and  don't stop running until you're  at the gates. It's a hundred yards,  so move it.
What are you going to...
That's my business.
Wait...   (he stops)  .. .Simon. Don't do this.   They'll kill you.   A long, tense pause.

The world can do without Simon  Templar. It can't do without you.   (smiles grimly)  See you around sometime.   He takes a deep breath and logrolls out.  ABOVE THE VAN - races from the van, heading in a direction away from the ACROSS THE STREET - ILYA double takes, seeing Templar spr van.

Kill him!  Ilya, Whitehead and Tretiak's men sprint down the street as they run, leaving --  JILLIAN UNDER THE VAN with a clear path to the embassy. S TEMPLAR dives behind an OVERTURNED CAR and comes up firin men.

head_text.subj: IN THE U. S. EMBASSY'S FRONT COURTYARD

text: Colonel Crosby watches the situation unfold.
What the hell is going on.   IN THE STREET - ILYA, WHITEHEAD and the other men close i laying down a withering fusillade of fire. Templar return car.
. . . nine. . . . TEN. . . .   Jillian logrolls out from under the van.   She sprints for the embassy gates.
sees Jillian running for the embassy. As he returns fire, his breath.
Go. Faster.. . .   ILYA, firing on Templar, sees Jillian. He spins, running going to get Jillian before she can reach the embassy.  J
Open the gate!  IN THE EMBASSY COURTYARD - COLONEL CROSBY turns to his se

Do it.   Lieutenant Jones and a MARINE PRIVATE push open the embas COLONEL CROSBY watches Jillian helplessly. There's nothin BEHIND THE OVERTURNED CAR - TEMPLAR dodges bullets, corni ILYA, with a desperate reach, collars Jillian. She shrugs ... and is instantly surrounded by U.S. Marines. Jillian
I'm an American citizen.

You have our full protection ma'am.   (looks at Ilya)  Back away from the gate.   Ilya's black eyes stare at Colonel Crosby. He backs away AT THE OVERTURNED CAR - TEMPLAR, out of bullets with his surrounded by Tretiak's men behind the overturned automob He's going to execute Templar right there, behind the ove IN THE EMBASSY COURTYARD - JILLIAN, watching, frantically
Do something!
That's Russian soil out there, ma'am.   Jillian turns away, horrified, shielding her eyes.

TEMPLAR (Russian)  Wait. A cigarette. It's customary.   Ilya looks at Templar. Looks at his men.   And Ilya laughs. Chuckling at first, then open-mouthed.   All of TRETIAK'S MEN laugh in Templar's face.   Ilya takes out a cigarette. Hands it to Templar.   Lights it for him.   TEMPLAR (Russian)  Thank-you.   And Ilya and Tretiak's men continue to laugh.   They won't be for long...   Because Templar is looking at A GRATE above the municipal TRETIAK'S MEN are sniffing the air, wondering why it smel eggs...   Templar flicks the cigarette into the grate and dives awa THE ENTIRE STREET IN FRONT OF THE U. S. EMBASSY blows sky GAS MAIN ignites .   Ilya, Whitehead, and the other men are blown off their fe Asphalt and dirt rain down, followed by --  WATER, as the municipal water main goes up.   Ilya and Whitehead get to their feet, looking around, wat monsoon.   Templar is gone.   And the police van is SPEEDING away.
Templar guns the van through Moscow streets. He pulls out phone. Punches numbers.
Remy stands by his jet, smoking a cigar, looking impatien cellular phone beeps.
Simon, where the hell are you...   You want me to do what?  Remy clicks off the phone and scrambles up into the cockp
Templar guns the van straight for --  A group of TRETIAK'S MEN conducting the building-to build pull two sedans into the intersection, blocking it.
Templar doesn't slow - he accelerates, and hits the two c bumpers meet, BLASTING through them --  -- and races on past the intersection.
Remy's Lear jet skirts Moscow rooftops, just 200 feet off us...

TEMPLAR'S POLICE VAN roars into Red Square as --  ON THE OTHER SIDE OF THE SQUARE - REMY'S LEAR JET touches Red Square. It taxis to a stop next to Lenin's tomb.   The police van SCREECHS up next to the Lear. Templar race the jet, dodging BULLETS fired from --  TRETIAK'S MEN, firing from sedans entering the square.   The Lear jet accelerates straight for the oncoming sedans scraping the landing gear against their windshields. It w clearing the top of the Ivan Memorial by a foot.   And heads west. To freedom.
A shot of the city as we SUPER:  St. Petersburg - two days later
The gates open. A BLACK SEDAN pulls into the drive and st out, then Dr. Singh, dressed in a conservative Indian sui briefcase. Tretiak emerges from the mansion, greeting Doc

Dr. Singh enters behind Tretiak and Zubov. They move to Z Dr. Singh dons reading glasses. Zubov places Jillian's re Singh flips a page, then another.   He is awed. It's like Salieri looking at Mozart's sheet m his life for something and... another person has found it

Yes.   (beat)  Yes.   (beat)  Yes, yes. . . . .   (looks up)  I will give you a list of the things I will need.  I requ (turns back to Jillian's document)  Leave me now. Please.   Tretiak and Zubov exchange a look. They exit. Dr. Singh r bearing down on the material, flipping through the pages PAGES being flipped, but these contain photographs...
No.   (beat)  No.   (beat)  No.
JILLIAN sits with F.B.I. agents RABINEAU and LONNER.
One more.   Rabineau flips the page. SIMON TEMPLAR'S PHOTO stares at studies it a moment. Shakes her head.
Be certain, Ms. St. Thomas. Look again.   She looks again. Studies Templar's photograph.
I'm certain. It's not him.   Agents Rabineau and Lonner exchange a look.
Jillian walks down the tree-lined mall.   Templar is standing there.   She walks up to him. A moment.
They showed me photographs  of criminals.   (beat)  And a photograph of you.
And...?
I said that the man in the photograph doesn't have the ey (pause; they stare at each other)  The Washington symposium is tomorrow afternoon.  I'm goin
What about your data...
It's in my head. I'll wing it.
(draws closer to her)  You need to conduct further research anyway. I'll help yo
What are we researching. ..?  Jillian draws closer. Their lips are almost touching...
The benefits of warm fusion.   Templar pulls her lips to his and CUT TO...
There follows a love scene.  Afterward, in each other's a
It is in the eyes.  You're not bad.
Being bad is the only thing  I've ever been good at.
You can be good at being good.   (she strokes his hair)  If you're afraid of the dark, remember the night rainbow.
Who said that?
(smiles privately)  My grandmother.   Templar gently takes her face in his hands.  Whispers to
How did I meet you.  This saint.   (smiles)  Saint Thomas.   They kiss.
Late at night. Dr. Singh is working feverishly. The desk and books. He is surrounded by three chalk boards with ch diagrams.  He is adding chemicals to a bath of hydrogen i

Zinc oxide. Iridium mercurate.   Sodium bicarbon nitrate.   A cobalt magnesium isotope.   Liquify the cobalt at 665 degrees  fahrenheit, add the magnesium. ...   The chemicals begin to mix.  He picks up an ELECTRODE NEE Dr. Singh takes a deep breath. He introduces the electrod compression chamber through a rubber valve.   And like a miracle, the LIGHTBULB ILLUMINATES. Dr. Singh just seen Shiva.
My god. It actually works.
The Capital on a cold, drizzly autumn day.

head_text.subj: A ROW OF FLASHBULBS EXPLODE POP POP POP...

text: PHOTOGRAPHERS are taking Jillian's picture as she moves t outside the Smithsonian. She is formally dressed. TWO F.B with her.   It is raining. The place is a sea of umbrellas.   Several REPORTERS trail after her.
Doctor St. Thomas! Ben Rothstein,  Omni Magazine. Is it true? Have you done it?
That question will be answered in  ten minutes, Mr. Rothstein.
Marilyn Jones, Doctor St. Thomas.   Dr. Vijay Singh has said that  your theories are insupportable...

(smiles)  Sorry, but I'm not interested in  Doctor Singh's opinions on this  or anything else.   JILLIAN moves up the steps, radiant and beautiful; it is life. She looks across the Mall.   TEMPLAR stands there. Alone, smiling at her.   Jillian winks at him, mouthing the words: "open it."  TEMPLAR understands. He pulls a GIFTWRAPPED BOX from his opens it. Inside is a TIE-PIN; a stick figure man with a Templar sticks it through his tie. Picks up the accompany INSERT - THE CARD reads:  Anyone can be a saint, Simon Templar.   Templar looks back at Jillian. He sees something.   Behind Jillian, moving toward her through the crowd, is a UNDER AN UMBRELLA. It looks like... Ilya.   Templar squints for clearer vision. He begins walking tow He quickens to a jog, now he's running...   ON THE SMITHSONIAN STEPS - THE REPORTERS crush into Jilli
Ms. St. Thomas, Ms. St. Thomas...
Please, no more questions. ...   Across the sea of people, TEMPLAR reaches the Blonde Man. his arm; whips him around.

Hey! What's the idea?  It's not Ilya, just a reporter with blonde hair.   Meanwhile JILLIAN, backing up the stairs from the reporte A DARK-HAIRED MAN, seen from behind, who lowers an umbrel button on the handle, revealing a GLISTENING NEEDLE POINT moves over his shoulder, revealing...ILYA. With dyed blac JILLIAN keeps backing up the stairs...   ...Behind her, Ilya's needled umbrella strikes her.   JILLIAN feels something. Like a bee sting. Her hand moves .. .as ILYA moves off through the crowd...   ...TEMPLAR comes through the crowd to Jillian. The F.B.I.
Stop it! I know him!  The Agents release Templar.   Jillian looks at him. Templar's panting, out of breath.
Simon? What is it?
Are you all right?
Yes.   (smiles)  Go get a seat.   Jillian moves up the stairs into the Smithsonian.   ACROSS THE MALL.. .ILYA is gone, melting into the sea of
The room is packed with scientists and reporters. Jillian front of the room.

Good afternoon. In 1989, two  physicists claimed to have perfected...   (her eyelids flutter)  .. .cold nuclear fusion.   Their results couldn't be duplicated. ...   Jillian is perspiring. She has cotton mouth. She picks up hand shakes.   TEMPLAR, seated in the back, watches her.
It is my pleasure to  announce that

(her eyes roll back)  ...have...   She opens her eyes. They're glassy.   And the world is swirling...   Jillian falls, her ice water SMASHING on the floor.   TEMPLAR runs to her, shoving people aside.
(kneels to her)  No. No. No...
One of the F.B.I. agents races off.
Simon...   (she's fading fast)  I love you...   (gasps for breath)  My Saint. . . . .
No. . . No. . .   God please no...   But God won't help you, Simon Templar...   ...God will take her anyway.
The next images collide and merge upon one another:
Nuclear physicist Jillian St. Thomas  suffered a cerebral aneurism...
Death occurred at two-fifty one p.m. ...
It is the ruling of this court that  death was due to natural...
.. ..and foul play was ruled out.   In international news, the  situation in St. Petersburg worsened...
The square is filled with thousands of MICHAEL ROMANOV SU They're camped out now.   A C.N.N. NEWS TEAM transmits from the square.

The scene is reminiscent  of the Tiananmen Square  crisis, Bernard.   The death toll stands at  forty-eight civilians and  at least twenty-one armed  forces personnel.   Rumors escalated today that...
A LIMOUSINE pulls through a 'crowd of ROMANOV SUPPORTERS heavily guarded gates of the Admiralty,  Russia's Naval headquarters, akin to Annapolis.

.. . General Nicolai Radischev...   (we see a photo of Radischev)  ...has promised Michael  Romanov his support, pending  the outcome of today's meeting  between Romanov and President Karpov.   ROMANOV, in the back of the limousine, waves to his suppo wild, clapping and cheering. The limo continues into the

The limousine rolls through a guarded checkpoint, stoppin THE ADMIRALTY'S NUCLEAR SITUATION FACILITY: in a more dan this is the place from which Russian military leaders wou war.   It's an acre-sized field of concrete, recessed 30 feet in like a very large, very deep swimming pool emptied of wat In the middle is a concave-shaped entrance hatch (visuali bowl turned upside down). The two halves of the concave h the middle, each side retracting into the facility.   On the concrete floor next to the hatch is a SMALL DETECT find about the unit shortly...   Romanov and four bodyguards exit the limousine. Two RUSSI SERVICEMEN escort Romanov to the entrance hatch. They des stairs to --
- - a large room dominated by an ELECTRONIC MAP OF THE WO computer stations run the length of the room. It looks li room.   The Secret Servicemen lead Romanov across the room to --
An office, relatively comfortable, with a computer, a tel a small satellite link.   VICTOR KARPOV, the popularly elected President of Russia, 55, intelligent, with a calm, professional demeanor.
A nuclear bunker, Mr. President?  You must worry for your safety.
I have reason to.
Yes. You do.   They glare at each other.
You understand my policy  on taping meetings.   Romanov consents with a wave of his hand. Karpov motions who flips the switch on a VIDEO CAMERA mounted in the wal

I'll get to the point.   Your remarks are irresponsible;  they've caused civil unrest. Unless  you appeal to your supporters  to stop rioting, I will institute martial law.   (beat)  Tell me what you want.
A public debate, then new  elections. We'll let the  people decide.
(considers this)  Agreed.   They shake hands.   Romanov rises and exits.
A HAND reaching for a SHOTGLASS. The hand shakes so badly the glass down. WIDEN TO --

-- TEMPLAR, drunk at noon in a wretched little dive on Av drawn and pale. Haunted. Hasn't slept or shaved for days. dirty.   TWO DARK-SUITED MEN enter. One pauses by the entrance, th to the bar. He sets a FOLDER on the bartop and slides it The two men exit.   Templar opens the folder. Inside is a plane ticket. A pla
Tretiak sits behind his desk. The room is dark.

The woman's death  was unfortunate.   You lost. I lost. To think  what we could have done  with her formula.   But life goes on, no?  TEMPLAR sits opposite Tretiak, staring at him. He is shav eyes utterly alert.

When Romanov gains the  presidency Russia will be ours.   The possibilities are, you would  agree, endless.   (beat)  You have talent. Unique talent.   I need that talent to break into an  impregnable facility. Be part of  this, Templar.
(considers this)  Fifteen million, plus the fifteen  you owe me.
I owe you nothing.   You were hired to steal  something and you failed.
Thirty million,  and I use my own men.
Twenty million, and one  of my men goes with you.   Templar nods in agreement. Rises. Goes to the door.
Templar. A question.   (Templar turns)  You had feelings for  the woman, didn't you?
I don't have feelings, Tretiak.   Templar, his face hard, cold, expressionless, exits.   Tretiak watches him.

A hotel in the heart of the city. We hear sounds of demon in the street below.   Templar sits at a table with Harry Winston, Remy Samarkan ARCHITECTURAL PLANS and PHOTOGRAPHS of the Admiralty's Nu Situation Facility are spread amongst room service trays. ILYA, and the massive ZERO sit on the couch, listening.   Ilya eyes Templar. Templar periodically meets Ilya's eyes glances are rife with hostility.   They've been at this a while and everyone's frustrated.
No, no, no, Karpov's office  is in the nuclear operations  room. The entry hatch  can't be activated from  above - only below.
It's lead-lined and reinforced  with eight feet of concrete.   Explosives and drills are out.
Electronic by-pass?

Negative. Understand something,  Simon, please: this is not a bank.   This is the former Soviet Union's  missile command.   Forced entry is impossible.   A long pause. Everyone looks at each other.   Templar examines A PHOTOGRAPH of the facility.   He fixates on it. He sees something.
What's that?  Templar points at the SMALL DETECTION UNIT next to the Nu entrance hatch.   Frankie looks at the photograph, then picks up a set of b flipping through...

Uhhm.. .that is the facility's...   (comes to the relevant page and reads:)  ... radiation detector.   In the event of nuclear  fall-out it automatically closes  the hatch.   Everyone turns to Templar.
You're saying the system can think.
Yes.
Then it can be lied to.

Romanov and Tretiak stand on one side of the lab.   ACROSS THE LAB, ZUBOV and DR. SINGH are huddled over a hy just like the one we saw in Jillian's lab. The tank is su testtubes and beakers containing chemicals.
The world will continue to spend half  its gross national product on oil.
And Russia will spend none. Within five years we will be wealthiest nation on earth.
And it's leaders, Romanov,  the most powerful people.

The situation in the city has worsened.   The ROMANOV SUPPORTERS outside the admiralty now number s thousand. They carry pro-Romanov banners and shout: DOWN KARPOV! In the b.g., we see more rioting. Gunfire crackli truck.   A MILITARY AMBULANCE careens around the corner and rolls Romanov supporters up to the Admiralty gates.   TWO RUSSIAN NAVY M.P.'s open the gates. The ambulance pul driver's window rolls down. It's Harry Winston dressed as

HARRY WINSTON (Russian)  Two soldiers shot by looters!  The M.P. waves the ambulance through. Harry waves back.   The ambulance pulls into the Admiralty compound, going pa the NAVAL HOSPITAL EMERGENCY WARD.

The ambulance pulls up next to the emergency ward.   The back door opens. Remy, dressed as a PARAMEDIC, gets o Harry haul out two heavily bandaged RUSSIAN SOLDIERS on s The stretchers expand into rolling gurneys. Harry and Rem soldiers inside.

Harry and Remy roll the gurneys through the emergency war DOCTORS and NURSES are scrambling around, attending to WO SOLDIERS. The scene is frenetic.   The gurneys roll past the operating rooms, through double room. No one notices.

A room stocked with hospital supplies. The wounded "soldi gurneys. They are TEMPLAR and ILYA. Ilya wears the unifor M.P. Templar wears a bulky, lead-lined anti-radiation sui Templar shoulders his backpack.   Harry Winston stands on a counter, pushing up the CEILING and Ilya climb atop the counter.   Harry forms a stirrup with his hands and hoists Templar, the hole in the ceiling.
Templar and Ilya crawl through the ventilation duct to a
